canonical_explanation.text: Animals can be classified in many ways. One important way is by whether they have a backbone or not. Vertebrates are animals with a backbone (internal skeleton), and invertebrates are animals without a backbone. Vertebrates include five main groups: mammals (warm-blooded, have hair or fur, give birth to babies, feed milk to young ones, e.g. cow, dog, whale, bat), birds (have feathers, lay eggs, most can fly, have beaks, e.g. parrot, eagle, penguin), reptiles (cold-blooded, have dry scaly skin, most lay eggs, e.g. snake, lizard, crocodile, turtle), amphibians (can live on land and in water, have moist skin, lay eggs in water, e.g. frog, toad, salamander), and fish (live in water, have fins and scales, breathe through gills, lay eggs, e.g. rohu, shark, goldfish). Insects are invertebrates with six legs, three body parts (head, thorax, abdomen), and most have wings. Common insects include butterflies, ants, bees, and mosquitoes. Some animals go through metamorphosis, a complete change in body form. The butterfly life cycle has four stages: egg, caterpillar (larva), pupa (chrysalis), and adult butterfly. The frog life cycle has stages: egg, tadpole, froglet, and adult frog.
rules: Vertebrates have a backbone; invertebrates do not
Mammals: warm-blooded, hair/fur, give birth to live young, feed milk
Birds: feathers, lay eggs, most can fly, have beaks
Reptiles: cold-blooded, dry scaly skin, most lay eggs
Amphibians: live on land and water, moist skin, lay eggs in water
Fish: live in water, fins and scales, breathe through gills
Insects: six legs, three body parts (head, thorax, abdomen)
Butterfly life cycle: egg → caterpillar → pupa → adult
Frog life cycle: egg → tadpole → froglet → adult frog
Metamorphosis means complete change in body form during growth

questions.question_text: Animals that have a backbone are called:
questions.explanation_correct: Animals with a backbone (internal skeleton with a spinal column) are called vertebrates. Examples include humans, dogs, fish, birds, and frogs. The backbone supports and protects the body.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Invertebrates are animals WITHOUT a backbone. Insects are one type of invertebrate. Amphibians are a group within vertebrates. The correct term for animals WITH a backbone is vertebrates.

questions.question_text: Which of these is an invertebrate (animal without a backbone)?
questions.explanation_correct: A butterfly is an invertebrate because it does not have a backbone. Butterflies are insects, and all insects are invertebrates. Dog, fish, and parrot are all vertebrates with backbones.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Dogs (mammals), fish, and parrots (birds) all have backbones, making them vertebrates. The butterfly is the only invertebrate in this list because insects do not have backbones.

questions.question_text: A snail has a shell but no backbone. Is a snail a vertebrate or an invertebrate?

options.text: Vertebrate, because it has a hard shell
Invertebrate, because it does not have a backbone

questions.explanation_correct: A snail is an invertebrate because it does not have a backbone. Having a shell does not make an animal a vertebrate. The key difference is the presence or absence of a backbone (internal skeleton).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Having a shell or being able to move does not make an animal a vertebrate. The only thing that matters is whether it has a backbone. Since a snail has no backbone, it is an invertebrate.

questions.question_text: True or False: Humans are vertebrates because they have a backbone.
questions.explanation_correct: This is true. Humans have a backbone (spine) made up of small bones called vertebrae. This makes us vertebrates. Humans belong to the mammal group of vertebrates.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement is true. Humans do have a backbone (spine) and are classified as vertebrates, specifically as mammals.

questions.question_text: Which of these groups contains ONLY vertebrates?
questions.explanation_correct: Frog (amphibian), parrot (bird), and fish are all vertebrates because they all have backbones. The other groups contain at least one invertebrate (ant, spider, earthworm, butterfly, bee, snail, cockroach, and crab are all invertebrates).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Ants, spiders, earthworms, butterflies, bees, snails, cockroaches, and crabs are all invertebrates. Only frog, parrot, and fish are all vertebrates with backbones.

questions.question_text: Which group of animals has feathers and lays eggs?
questions.explanation_correct: Birds are the only animals that have feathers. They also lay eggs and most of them can fly. Feathers help birds fly, keep them warm, and make them waterproof. Examples include sparrow, eagle, and parrot.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Mammals have hair/fur. Reptiles have scales. Fish have scales and fins. Only birds have feathers, which is a unique feature that sets them apart from all other animal groups.

questions.question_text: Mammals are different from other animals because they:

options.text: Feed milk to their young ones and have hair or fur
Live only in water and have gills

questions.explanation_correct: Mammals are special because they feed milk to their babies and have hair or fur on their bodies. They are also warm-blooded and most give birth to live young (not eggs). Cows, dogs, and humans are mammals.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Laying eggs and scales belong to reptiles, feathers and flying belong to birds, and gills belong to fish. The unique features of mammals are feeding milk to young ones and having hair or fur.

questions.question_text: Which of these is a reptile?
questions.explanation_correct: A crocodile is a reptile. Reptiles have dry, scaly skin, are cold-blooded, and most lay eggs on land. Other reptiles include snakes, lizards, and turtles.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A frog is an amphibian, a whale is a mammal (it feeds milk to its baby), and a sparrow is a bird. The crocodile is the reptile in this list, with its scaly skin and cold-blooded nature.

questions.question_text: Fish breathe through:
questions.explanation_correct: Fish breathe through gills. Gills are special organs on the sides of a fish's head that can take in oxygen from water. As water passes over the gills, oxygen is absorbed into the fish's blood.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Lungs are used by mammals, birds, and reptiles to breathe air. Fish cannot breathe air; they use gills to extract oxygen dissolved in water.

questions.question_text: Amphibians can live:

options.text: Both on land and in water

questions.explanation_correct: Amphibians can live both on land and in water. The word 'amphi' means both and 'bios' means life. Frogs, toads, and salamanders are amphibians that spend part of their life in water and part on land.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Amphibians are special because they can survive in both environments. They usually start life in water (as tadpoles) and later live on land. They are not limited to just one habitat.

questions.question_text: A whale lives in the ocean and has fins. Is it a fish?

options.text: Yes, because it lives in water
No, it is a mammal because it feeds milk to its baby and breathes air through lungs

questions.explanation_correct: A whale is NOT a fish. It is a mammal. Even though it lives in water, a whale breathes air through lungs, feeds milk to its baby, and is warm-blooded. These are all mammal characteristics.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Living in water or having fins does not automatically make an animal a fish. A whale is a mammal because it breathes air, feeds milk to its babies, and is warm-blooded. These features make it a mammal, not a fish.

questions.question_text: A bat can fly. Is it a bird?

options.text: No, it is a mammal because it has fur and feeds milk to its babies

questions.explanation_correct: A bat is NOT a bird. It is a mammal. Even though bats can fly, they have fur (not feathers), give birth to live babies (not eggs), and feed milk to their young. These are mammal features.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Being able to fly does not make an animal a bird. Birds have feathers, but bats have fur. Bats give birth to babies and feed them milk, making them mammals. They are the only mammals that can truly fly.

questions.question_text: A penguin cannot fly. Is it still a bird?

options.text: Yes, because it has feathers and lays eggs
No, it is a fish because it swims

questions.explanation_correct: A penguin IS a bird even though it cannot fly. It has all the features of a bird: feathers, a beak, and it lays eggs. Penguins are excellent swimmers and use their wings as flippers in water.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Not all birds can fly, but all birds have feathers and lay eggs. A penguin has feathers, a beak, and lays eggs, so it is definitely a bird. Flying is not the only feature that defines a bird.

questions.question_text:
Match the animal group with its body covering:
1. Mammals - (a) Scales and fins
2. Birds - (b) Dry scales
3. Reptiles - (c) Hair or fur
4. Fish - (d) Feathers

Choose the correct matching:
questions.explanation_correct: Mammals have hair or fur (1-c), Birds have feathers (2-d), Reptiles have dry scales (3-b), and Fish have scales and fins (4-a). Each group has a unique body covering.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Remember the body coverings: Mammals = hair/fur, Birds = feathers, Reptiles = dry scales, Fish = scales and fins. The correct matching is 1-c, 2-d, 3-b, 4-a.

questions.question_text: Animals that are cold-blooded and have dry, scaly skin are called ________.
questions.explanation_correct: Reptiles are cold-blooded animals with dry, scaly skin. Examples include snakes, lizards, crocodiles, and turtles. Their body temperature changes with the temperature of their surroundings.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Mammals have fur and are warm-blooded. Birds have feathers. Amphibians have moist skin. Cold-blooded animals with dry, scaly skin are reptiles.

questions.question_text: Which feature do mammals and birds have in common?
questions.explanation_correct: Both mammals and birds are warm-blooded, meaning their body temperature stays the same regardless of the outside temperature. This is different from reptiles, amphibians, and fish, which are cold-blooded.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Feathers are only for birds, scales for reptiles and fish. Most mammals give birth to live young (don't lay eggs). But both mammals and birds share the feature of being warm-blooded.

questions.question_text: How many legs does an insect have?
questions.explanation_correct: All insects have six legs. This is one of the key features that identify an insect. Whether it is an ant, a butterfly, a bee, or a grasshopper, all insects have exactly six legs.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Four legs are for most mammals and reptiles. Eight legs are for spiders (which are NOT insects). Ten legs are for crabs. All insects have exactly six legs.

questions.question_text: An insect's body is divided into how many parts?

options.text: Four: head, neck, chest, and stomach

questions.explanation_correct: An insect's body is divided into three parts: the head (eyes, antennae, mouthparts), the thorax (middle part where legs and wings are attached), and the abdomen (back part with digestive organs).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Insects always have three distinct body parts: head, thorax, and abdomen. This three-part body is one of the key features used to identify insects.

questions.question_text: A spider has eight legs. Is it an insect?

options.text: Yes, because it is small like an insect
No, because insects have six legs, not eight
Yes, because it has a hard body

questions.explanation_correct: A spider is NOT an insect. Insects always have six legs, but a spider has eight legs. Spiders also have only two body parts (not three). Spiders belong to a different group called arachnids.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Being small, catching flies, or having a hard body does not make something an insect. The key features of insects are six legs and three body parts. Since a spider has eight legs, it is not an insect.

questions.question_text: Which of these is NOT an insect?
questions.explanation_correct: An earthworm is NOT an insect. It does not have six legs or three body parts. An earthworm has a long, soft body with no legs at all. Ants, butterflies, and bees all have six legs and are insects.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Ants, butterflies, and bees are all insects with six legs and three body parts. An earthworm has no legs and no distinct body parts like an insect, so it is not an insect.

questions.question_text: True or False: All insects can fly.
questions.explanation_correct: This is false. While most insects have wings and can fly, some insects like ants (worker ants) and some beetles cannot fly. All insects have six legs, but not all of them have functional wings.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement is false. Although many insects can fly, there are insects like ants and some beetles that do not have wings or cannot fly.

questions.question_text: Which of the following features is shared by ALL insects?

options.text: They all have six legs and three body parts

questions.explanation_correct: All insects share two key features: six legs and three body parts (head, thorax, abdomen). Not all insects can fly (ants), not all have visible wings, and only bees make honey.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Not all insects fly or have wings, and only bees make honey. The features common to ALL insects are six legs and three body parts (head, thorax, abdomen).

questions.question_text: What is the correct order of a butterfly's life cycle?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order of a butterfly's life cycle is: Egg → Caterpillar (larva) → Pupa (chrysalis) → Adult butterfly. The caterpillar eats leaves and grows, then forms a pupa where it transforms into a beautiful butterfly.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The life cycle always starts with an egg. The egg hatches into a caterpillar (larva), which then becomes a pupa (chrysalis), and finally emerges as an adult butterfly. The correct order is Egg → Caterpillar → Pupa → Adult.

questions.question_text: In a butterfly's life cycle, what does the caterpillar become?
questions.explanation_correct: The caterpillar becomes a pupa (also called chrysalis). Inside the pupa, the caterpillar's body completely changes and transforms into an adult butterfly. This amazing change is called metamorphosis.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The caterpillar does not become an egg, turn directly into a butterfly, or become a tadpole (that is part of a frog's life cycle). The caterpillar first becomes a pupa, and the butterfly emerges from the pupa.

questions.question_text: What is the correct order of a frog's life cycle?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order of a frog's life cycle is: Egg → Tadpole → Froglet → Adult frog. Frog eggs are laid in water, tadpoles live in water and breathe through gills, then they grow legs and become froglets, and finally adult frogs.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The life cycle starts with eggs laid in water. Eggs hatch into tadpoles (with tails, no legs), which grow into froglets (with legs), and finally become adult frogs. The order is Egg → Tadpole → Froglet → Adult.

questions.question_text: What is metamorphosis?

options.text: A complete change in body form during the life cycle
An animal sleeping for a long time

questions.explanation_correct: Metamorphosis is a complete change in the body form of an animal during its life cycle. For example, a caterpillar looks completely different from the butterfly it becomes. A tadpole looks very different from an adult frog.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Simply growing bigger is not metamorphosis. Metamorphosis means a dramatic change in body form, like a crawling caterpillar becoming a flying butterfly, or a swimming tadpole becoming a jumping frog.

questions.question_text: A tadpole has a tail and breathes through gills. An adult frog has legs and breathes through lungs. What does this change show?

options.text: Metamorphosis - a complete change in body form

questions.explanation_correct: The dramatic change from a tadpole (with tail, gills, no legs) to an adult frog (with legs, lungs, no tail) is an excellent example of metamorphosis. The body form changes completely during growth.
questions.explanation_incorrect: These changes are not due to sickness, food, or colour change. The complete transformation of a tadpole into a frog - losing the tail, growing legs, and switching from gills to lungs - is metamorphosis.

questions.question_text: Which of these animals goes through metamorphosis?
questions.explanation_correct: A butterfly goes through metamorphosis. It changes from an egg to a caterpillar to a pupa to an adult butterfly. A dog puppy looks like a small dog, a chick looks like a small hen, and a baby fish looks like a small fish - these do not undergo metamorphosis.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Dogs, hens, and fish do not go through metamorphosis. Their young look like smaller versions of the adults. Only the butterfly undergoes a complete body transformation (egg → caterpillar → pupa → butterfly).

questions.question_text: True or False: A tadpole breathes through gills, just like a fish.
questions.explanation_correct: This is true. A tadpole lives in water and breathes through gills, just like a fish. As it grows into a froglet and then an adult frog, it develops lungs and can breathe air on land.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement is actually true. Tadpoles live in water and breathe through gills. It is only after metamorphosis that frogs develop lungs for breathing air.

questions.question_text: How is the life cycle of a butterfly different from the life cycle of a dog?

options.text: A butterfly lays eggs but a dog does not
A butterfly goes through metamorphosis but a puppy looks like a small adult dog
A dog grows bigger but a butterfly does not

questions.explanation_correct: The key difference is that a butterfly goes through metamorphosis (complete body change: egg → caterpillar → pupa → butterfly), while a puppy already looks like a small version of an adult dog and just grows bigger.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The main difference is metamorphosis. A butterfly's body completely changes form during its life cycle. A puppy looks like a small dog from birth and simply grows bigger without changing body form.

questions.question_text: Which of these statements is INCORRECT?

options.text: Amphibians can only live in water
Mammals feed milk to their young

questions.explanation_correct: The statement 'Amphibians can only live in water' is INCORRECT. Amphibians can live BOTH on land and in water, not only in water. The word 'amphibian' itself means 'double life' (in water and on land).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Fish do breathe through gills, reptiles do have dry scaly skin, and mammals do feed milk to their young - these are all correct. The incorrect statement is about amphibians, which can live on both land AND water.

questions.question_text: During winter, a snake lies in the sun to warm itself. Why does it need to do this?

options.text: Because snakes are cold-blooded and their body temperature depends on their surroundings
Because snakes need sunlight to see
Because the sun makes snakes stronger

questions.explanation_correct: Snakes are reptiles and are cold-blooded. This means their body temperature changes with their surroundings. They lie in the sun to warm up because their bodies cannot produce heat on their own like mammals can.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Snakes do not sunbathe for fun or to see better. They are cold-blooded, which means they cannot keep their body warm on their own. They need heat from the sun to warm their bodies and stay active.

questions.question_text: The stage in a butterfly's life cycle where it is wrapped in a covering and the body changes completely is called the ________ stage.
questions.explanation_correct: The pupa (also called chrysalis) is the stage where the caterpillar wraps itself in a covering and its body completely transforms into a butterfly. This is the most dramatic stage of metamorphosis.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The egg is the first stage, the caterpillar is the eating stage, and larva is another name for caterpillar. The pupa (chrysalis) is the stage where the body transforms inside a covering.

questions.question_text: Which of these is a vertebrate that lives in water?
questions.explanation_correct: A shark is a vertebrate (has a backbone) that lives in water. It is a fish. Despite their names, jellyfish and starfish are invertebrates and not actual fish. An octopus is also an invertebrate.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Despite having 'fish' in their names, jellyfish and starfish are NOT fish and do not have backbones. Octopus also has no backbone. The shark is the only vertebrate in this list - it is a true fish.

questions.question_text: Which of these animals lays eggs?
questions.explanation_correct: A hen is a bird, and all birds lay eggs. Dogs, cats, and cows are mammals that give birth to live young. Laying eggs is a characteristic of birds, most reptiles, amphibians, and fish.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Dogs, cats, and cows are mammals that give birth to live babies and feed them milk. The hen is a bird and lays eggs. All birds reproduce by laying eggs.

questions.question_text: Which of these animals is an insect?
questions.explanation_correct: A grasshopper is an insect because it has six legs and three body parts (head, thorax, abdomen). Spiders and scorpions have eight legs (arachnids), and centipedes have many legs - none of these are insects.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Only animals with exactly six legs and three body parts are insects. Spiders (8 legs), scorpions (8 legs), and centipedes (many legs) are not insects. The grasshopper, with its six legs, is the insect.

questions.question_text: A turtle lives in water, has a shell and scaly skin, and lays eggs on land. Which group does it belong to?
questions.explanation_correct: A turtle is a reptile. It has dry, scaly skin and lays eggs on land, which are features of reptiles. Even though some turtles live in water, they are not fish (no gills) or amphibians (no moist skin).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Turtles breathe air with lungs (not gills like fish), have dry scaly skin (not moist like amphibians), and do not feed milk (like mammals). Their scaly skin and egg-laying on land make them reptiles.

questions.question_text: Which animal goes through metamorphosis like the butterfly?
questions.explanation_correct: A frog goes through metamorphosis just like a butterfly. It changes from egg → tadpole (lives in water, has tail, breathes through gills) → froglet → adult frog (lives on land, has legs, breathes through lungs).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Chickens, cats, and elephants do not undergo metamorphosis. Their young look like smaller versions of adults. Only the frog, like the butterfly, goes through a complete body transformation.

questions.question_text: True or False: All animals that live in water are fish.
questions.explanation_correct: This is false. Many animals live in water but are not fish. Whales and dolphins are mammals. Crocodiles and sea turtles are reptiles. Frogs (as tadpoles) are amphibians. Crabs and jellyfish are invertebrates. Only animals with gills, fins, and scales are fish.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement is false. Living in water does not make an animal a fish. Whales (mammals), turtles (reptiles), and tadpoles (amphibians) all live in water but are not fish.

questions.question_text: Ants live in large groups called colonies. They have six legs and three body parts. What type of animal are ants?
questions.explanation_correct: Ants are insects because they have six legs and three body parts (head, thorax, abdomen). These are the key features of all insects. Ants are one of the most common insects found everywhere.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Mammals have fur and feed milk. Reptiles have scales. Arachnids have eight legs. Ants have six legs and three body parts, making them insects.

questions.question_text: Why do frogs lay their eggs in water?

options.text: Because frogs cannot walk on land
Because frog eggs need water to survive and tadpoles live in water
Because there are fewer enemies in water
Because frogs only live in water

questions.explanation_correct: Frogs lay eggs in water because their eggs do not have hard shells and need water to stay moist. Also, tadpoles that hatch from these eggs live in water and breathe through gills before developing into adult frogs.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Frogs can walk and jump on land. They also live on land as adults. But they lay eggs in water because frog eggs need moisture to survive, and tadpoles need water to live and grow.

questions.question_text: Classify the following animal: It has fur, gives birth to live babies, and feeds milk. What type of animal is it?
questions.explanation_correct: An animal with fur, that gives birth to live babies and feeds milk, is a mammal. These are the defining characteristics of mammals. Dogs, cats, cows, and humans are all mammals.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Birds have feathers, reptiles have scales, and amphibians have moist skin. An animal with fur that gives birth to live young and feeds milk is definitely a mammal.

questions.question_text: What does a caterpillar do before becoming a pupa?

options.text: It eats lots of leaves and grows bigger

questions.explanation_correct: Before becoming a pupa, a caterpillar eats large amounts of leaves to grow big and store energy. It needs this energy for the transformation that happens inside the pupa when it changes into a butterfly.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Caterpillars cannot fly (that is what butterflies do), they do not lay eggs (adults do), and they do not swim. They spend their time eating leaves and growing bigger before entering the pupa stage.

questions.question_text: Animals that have moist skin and can live both on land and in water are called ________.
questions.explanation_correct: Amphibians have moist skin and can live both on land and in water. Frogs, toads, and salamanders are common examples. The word 'amphibian' comes from Greek words meaning 'double life'.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Reptiles have dry, scaly skin. Fish live only in water. Mammals have fur. Animals with moist skin that live on both land and water are amphibians.

questions.question_text:
Which of the following is the correct group for each animal?
(i) Cobra (ii) Dolphin (iii) Eagle (iv) Salmon
questions.explanation_correct: Cobra is a reptile (scaly skin, cold-blooded). Dolphin is a mammal (breathes air, feeds milk to young). Eagle is a bird (feathers, lays eggs). Salmon is a fish (gills, fins, scales).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Remember: Cobra has scales (reptile). Dolphin breathes air and feeds milk (mammal, not fish!). Eagle has feathers (bird). Salmon lives in water with gills (fish). The correct answer is (i) Reptile, (ii) Mammal, (iii) Bird, (iv) Fish.

questions.question_text: The three body parts of an insect are the head, thorax, and abdomen. Where are the legs attached?
questions.explanation_correct: All six legs of an insect are attached to the thorax (middle part of the body). The thorax is also where the wings are attached. The head has eyes and antennae, and the abdomen contains digestive organs.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The legs are not attached to the head or abdomen. They are all attached to the thorax, which is the middle part of an insect's body. The thorax is like the engine room where legs and wings are connected.

questions.question_text: A mosquito also goes through metamorphosis. What is the correct order of its life cycle?
questions.explanation_correct: The mosquito life cycle follows the same pattern as the butterfly: Egg → Larva (wriggler that lives in water) → Pupa → Adult mosquito. Mosquito eggs are laid in stagnant water, which is why we should not let water collect in containers.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Like the butterfly, the mosquito goes through egg, larva, pupa, and adult stages in that order. The correct sequence is Egg → Larva → Pupa → Adult mosquito.

questions.question_text: True or False: A snake is an invertebrate because it has no legs.
questions.explanation_correct: This is false. A snake IS a vertebrate even though it has no legs. Vertebrate means having a backbone, not legs. Snakes have a long backbone with many vertebrae. Having legs is not required to be a vertebrate.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement is false. Having no legs does not make an animal an invertebrate. Snakes have a backbone (many vertebrae), so they are vertebrates. The classification is based on backbone, not legs.

questions.question_text: Which feature helps us tell apart a reptile from an amphibian?

options.text: Reptiles have dry, scaly skin while amphibians have moist skin
Reptiles can swim but amphibians cannot
Reptiles eat plants but amphibians eat insects

questions.explanation_correct: The key difference is skin type. Reptiles have dry, scaly skin, while amphibians have moist, smooth skin. Amphibians need to keep their skin moist, which is why they are often found near water.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Both reptiles and amphibians can swim, and their size varies. Diet also varies among species. The most reliable difference is their skin: reptiles have dry scales, amphibians have moist skin.

questions.question_text: Which of these pairs of animals BOTH go through metamorphosis?
questions.explanation_correct: Both butterflies and frogs go through metamorphosis. A butterfly changes from caterpillar to butterfly, and a frog changes from tadpole to adult frog. Both undergo a complete change in body form.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Dogs, cats, hens, cows, fish, and birds do not undergo metamorphosis. Their young look like smaller versions of adults. Only butterflies and frogs (and some other insects and amphibians) go through metamorphosis.
